column4: Hi there - 2 questions: 1) I just updated my Natty OS and my X server won't start.  This is a serious problem .. can anyone help me?  2) I want to compile the NVidia kernel module manually but it says the X server is running.  How do I stop it?  Thank you.
why the manual way?
because I tried sudo apt-get install --reinstall nvidia-current and that did not fix my problem.
try uninstalling it then reinstalling
I'm running into the same problem as before.  dmesg reports: http://paste.ubuntu.com/721117/
what did you do again?
I don't know for sure.  This morning I logged in remotely, it says reboot required, so I rebooted.
sorry id forgotten already.. yeah the kernel would have gone from 2.38 to 3
I see.  Can I kill the X server and compile the kernel module myself?
upgrading is a pita
it says my kernel version is still 2.6.38
oh, just update the packages? i htought you went from 11.04 to 10.10?
when I uninstalled I don't get the kernel panic, but I don't get any display at all.  The screen is garbled
what card is it btw?
it's a Quadro 600.  Not sure what architecture.
no
it's like I get half a magenta square with some green lines and the rest is black
it could be the firmware nouveau is trying to load
is there no way to kill the X server?
have you tried fully draining the power and letting it rest for couple minutes?
sorry i forgot you had access to terminal
I'll be back later.  Have to go somewhere right now
what abou backup files and clean install?
I would rather not have to do that .. this is my workstation and it has hundreds of GB of data on it, and I have spent 30+ hours compiling and installing things
